e5: An ethical reporting policy should be transparent, honest, and accurately reflect the company's financial performance. It must ensure that stakeholders, including both sophisticated and retail investors, have equal access to truthful information, minimizing misunderstandings or harmful practices. Legal compliance and fostering trust through consistency align such policies with long-term shareholder value and corporate responsibility.
e6: Yes, follow-up questions include: How will the company communicate the shift to the new reporting policy to all investors to avoid confusion? What strategies will be implemented to track and address any impacts on the stock price after the policy change? How do we manage investor relations to maintain trust while transitioning policies?
